questions.text: A person is accused of committing Rape. He claims to be adolescent. He is brought to the government hospital for age estimation to determine if he should be sent to juvenile home or an adult jail. The X-ray image of the pelvis is shown below. What is the age?
Area covered under the two ‘Points of Inflection’ in the Normal distribution curve is?

In a complex medical malpractice lawsuit, Amit, a 40-year-old patient, underwent a routine laparoscopic cholecystectomy at a reputable hospital. The surgery was performed by Dr. Sheela, a highly skilled surgeon. However, during the procedure, an unforeseen event occurred. Amit sustained a deep laceration to her abdominal aorta, a major blood vessel, which required immediate vascular surgery to repair. Despite the seriousness of the injury, Amit's legal team encountered difficulties in identifying the precise cause of the aortic laceration or pinpointing a specific act of negligence. There were no clear breaches of established surgical protocols, and Dr. Sheela's credentials and experience were impeccable. In the context of this challenging case, which legal doctrine might Amit's legal team invoke to establish negligence?
Dodd sign is absent in juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma because?

options.label: A
options.text: JNA arises from posterior pharyngeal wall

options.label: C
options.text: JNA spreads submucosally from its point of origin

options.label: D
options.text: JNA do not have muscular contractile part in its blood vessels

questions.correct_answer: C. JNA spreads submucosally from its point of origin
questions.explanation: Ans. C. JNA spreads submucosally from its point of origin

questions.text: Find the Incorrect statement about Contraceptives used in RCH program?

options.label: A
options.text: MALA N contains 60 mg Ferrous fumarate

options.label: B
options.text: CuT 375 has a shelf life of 4-5 years

options.label: D
options.text: CHHAYA should be taken 1 tablet a week since start

questions.correct_answer: D. CHHAYA should be taken 1 tablet a week since start
questions.explanation: Ans. D. CHHAYA should be taken 1 tablet a week since start

A forensic investigator is examining a series of bruises on a victim's body. To determine whether these bruises are artificial or true bruises, which of the following characteristics would be most useful to assess?

A welder presents to the emergency department with fever, chills, headache, fatigue, and muscle aches after working with galvanized steel for several hours. The place of work is poorly ventilated. On physical examination, his vital signs are stable, and there are no specific findings on examination. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's symptoms?

A 27-year-old patient presents to your clinic with complaints of inward deviation of the left eye that has been there since past 10 years. Visual acuity in both eyes is 20/20, and there are no signs of amblyopia. On examination, you note a left compensatory face turn and on doing a PBCT a deviation measuring 30 prism diopters is noted. The alternate cover test confirms this measurement. What is the appropriate surgical correction for this patient's left eye strabismus ?

options.label: A
options.text: Right medial rectus recession and left lateral rectus recession

options.label: C
options.text: Left lateral rectus recession and medial rectus recession

options.label: D
options.text: Left lateral rectus resection and medial rectus recession

questions.correct_answer: D. Left lateral rectus resection and medial rectus recession
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Left lateral rectus resection and medial rectus recession

questions.text: A patient presented with right sided hardness of hearing. Otoendoscopy and pure tone audiometry were given below. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the condition in this patient ?

options.label: A
options.text: Transformer ratio is decreased after surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Stapedial reflex is intact after surgery

options.label: C
options.text: The contents of the middle ear that are modified in this surgery develop from 1 st pharyngeal arch

questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Surgery is contraindicated

Explanation:

  • • Transformer ratio increases because the diameter of the piston will be around 0.8mm. Hence areal ratio (45mm2 / 0.8mm2) will be increased 4 times when compared to normal areal ratio (45mm2 / 3.2mm2). Lever ratio remains same.
  • • As stapedius tendon is cut during surgery, stapedial reflex is lost after surgery.
  • • The contents of the middle ear that are modified in this surgery develop from 2 nd pharyngeal arch. Stapes suprastructure (which develops from 2 nd arch) is removed. Stapedius tendon (which belongs to 2 nd arch) is cut.

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient presents with a history of open-angle glaucoma. Despite using prostaglandin analogs and beta-blockers, their intraocular pressure (IOP) remains elevated. Which of the following medications should be considered as an adjunctive therapy in this case?

A Pregnant woman in third trimester complains of hearing her own sounds. Examination of the ear shows movements of tympanic membrane synchronous with respiration and especially exaggerated when nostril on the contralateral side is occluded. Your diagnosis is:

Identify the correct pair Benefit measured in terms of natural units-Cost benefit analysis Method based on behavioral sciences-MBO PERT-Network Analysis Benefit measured in terms of QALY-Cost effective analysis

options.label: B
options.text: It is based on Annual growth rate of a country

options.label: C
options.text: Total population consistently increase from Stage 1 through end of Stage 5

questions.correct_answer: D. Demographic transition model has 4 stages
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Demographic transition model has 4 stages

questions.text: The following coronal section of CT PNS is taken at which level.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: 1-1.5 cms behind the posterior end of the inferior turbinate

options.label: C
options.text: 1-1.5 cms behind the posterior end of the middle turbinate

options.label: D
options.text: 1-1.5 cms behind the anterior end of the middle turbinate

questions.correct_answer: A. 1-1.5 cms behind the anterior end of the inferior turbinate

questions.text: During live presentation of Dr Apurv’s class there is a sudden blackout. Mrs Jagruti Walia - the head of Ops team immediately sends for a backup generator. During connecting the generator a 35-year-old worker gets accidental exposure to a petrochemical substance resulting in severe eye pain and blurred vision. On examination, his affected eye appears red and edematous. Immediately in-house ophthalmologist Dr Gaurav is called upon, you are an intern accompanying him. Which of the following you would DEFINITELY NOT see Dr Gaurav doing during the treatment of the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Starting frequent steroid eye drops to enhance recovery

options.label: B
options.text: Patching the eye with pad and Bandage to provide relief

options.label: C
options.text: Saying that Limbal ischemia is associated with a poor prognosis

options.label: D
options.text: Washing the eyes with double eversion of upper lid and sweeping the fornices

questions.correct_answer: B. Patching the eye with pad and Bandage to provide relief

questions.text: A 60-year-old man presented with decreased hearing on right side. You have done tuning fork tests and found that Rinne was negative on right side and Weber lateralised to the right ear. Otoendoscopy picture is shown below. Where do you expect the primary pathology? Find the relevant picture in the given options.
Incorrect combination about Instruments used in Public Health and their use is

options.label: B
options.text: Dial thermometer – Cold chain temperature monitoring of ILR

options.label: D
options.text: Salter’s scale – Weight of a newborn

questions.correct_answer: A. Horrock’s apparatus – Residual chlorine level
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Horrock’s apparatus – Residual chlorine level

questions.text: A patient has undergone a procedure that is shown in the following picture. BERA test was done after the procedure (sound stimulus was directly given from outside to the processor instead of giving through earphone in ear canal). Which waves will be found abnormal?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. I & II

Explanation:

  • • After ABSI, the sound waves will directly reach the brainstem bypassing the auditory nerve. Hence the waves corresponding to brainstem nuclei and central cortex (III to VII) will be present. The waves related to eighth nerve will be absent (I & II).

questions.text: The formula given by: True positives / (True positives + False Positives) X 100 represents?
Which of the following method of health communication is didactic in nature?

A 30-year-old individual diagnosed with schizophrenia commits an act that would otherwise be considered a criminal offense. The act was committed during a period of acute psychotic episode. The individual's medical history indicates sporadic adherence to prescribed antipsychotic medication. The prosecution has charged the individual with the offense. Based on the provided information, which of the following statements is most accurate regarding the applicability of Section 84 of IPC in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: The accused cannot invoke Section 84 since the act was committed while not adhering to prescribed medication.

options.label: B
options.text: Section 84 applies as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence

options.label: C
options.text: Section 84 is inapplicable due to the sporadic nature of the individual's symptoms

options.label: D
options.text: The accused can only invoke Section 84 if the act was committed during a state of complete unconsciousness

questions.correct_answer: B. Section 84 applies as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Section 84 applies as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence.

questions.text: In the realm of medical practice, the principle of vicarious liability plays a crucial role in determining legal responsibility. Which of the following statements best exemplifies the concept of vicarious liability in cases of medical negligence?

options.label: A
options.text: Medical institutions can only be held responsible for the actions of their employed medical professionals if institution had direct knowledge of the negligence.

options.label: B
options.text: Vicarious liability does not apply when medical professionals commit gross negligence, as such actions are considered beyond the scope of their employment.

options.label: C
options.text: Vicarious liability extends to situations where medical professionals are acting as independent contractors within a medical institution

options.label: D
options.text: Vicarious liability mandates that medical institutions are immune to legal action if the medical professional involved had a valid license to practice.

questions.correct_answer: C. Vicarious liability extends to situations where medical professionals are acting as independent contractors within a medical institution
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Vicarious liability extends to situations where medical professionals are acting as independent contractors within a medical institution

questions.text: A 28-year-old female presents to her healthcare provider seeking contraception. She has no significant medical history to hormonal contraceptives. Due to her poor socio-economic status, the health care provider suggests the OCPs available free of cost under NFWP. What is the composition of the OCP?

options.label: A
options.text: Ethinyl estradiol 0.03 mcg, Levonorgestrel 0.15 mcg, Fe fumarate 30mg

options.label: B
options.text: Ethinyl estradiol 30 mcg, Levonorgestrel 150 mcg, Fe sulphate 60mg

options.label: C
options.text: Ethinyl estradiol 0.03 mg, Levonorgestrel 0.15 mg, Fe fumarate 60mg

options.label: D
options.text: Ethinyl estradiol 0.03 mg, Levonorgestrel 0.15 mg, Fe sulphate 30mg

questions.correct_answer: C. Ethinyl estradiol 0.03 mg, Levonorgestrel 0.15 mg, Fe fumarate 60mg
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Ethinyl estradiol 0.03 mg, Levonorgestrel 0.15 mg, Fe fumarate 60mg
